alert.note: Alert for Graham; Haywood; Macon; Northern Jackson; Southern Jackson; Swain; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 03 at 3:55AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Georgia, western North Carolina and upstate South Carolina, including the following areas. In Georgia, Habersham and Rabun Counties. In North Carolina, Graham, Haywood, Macon, Jackson, Swain and Transylvania. In South Carolina, mountainous northern portions of Oconee and Pickens Counties. * WHEN...From this evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A cold front will move into the area from the west, producing widespread rainfall. Rainfall amount of 2 to 4 inches is expected between now and Friday, with localized totals up to 5 inches. This could cause localized flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Graham; Haywood; Macon; Northern Jackson; Southern Jackson; Swain; Transylvania
